intro: Orthosia ventensis, commonly known as the Sierra Madre orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a short, stout stem and a basal rosette of leaves that help it conserve water in its native habitat.
